The claim was based on a reference repor: titled "Empower young women and adolescent girls," which stated that in 2013, 74 percent of new HIV infections among people between ages 15 and 24 in Africa occurred in adolescent girls.
The report: s footnotes section only listed "2013 UNAIDS data" as its source, raising questions about the origin and accuracy of the data.
The majority of AIDS estimates in Africa: Saharan Africa, treating North Africa as a separate region or part of the Middle East.
The 2016 Prevention Gap Report: which collects HIV data and analyzes infection trends from 146 countries, also highlights the high prevalence of HIV infections among young women in eastern and southern Africa.
